title: Exit Visa
description:
01 Prayer Call.mp3
02 Roll Over Mohammed.mp3
03 They're Gonna Make Me A Saudi.mp3
04 Way Down In Bahta Street.mp3
05 Sheikh, Rattle And Roll.mp3
06 When We're 64.mp3
07 Go To Jeddah.mp3
08 Someone's Crashing.mp3
09 I'm Proud To Be A Saudi.mp3
10 Crash My Toyota.mp3
11 Toyota On The Hill.mp3
12 On The First Day Of Ramadan.mp3
13 Hi Ho, Hi Hee, I Am A Yemeni.mp3
14 Hamdila, Bukhera, Inshalah, Malish.mp3

This was a multiple boot-leg copy that was circulated in Saudia Arabia in 1970's. Because of this, the quality was terrible - cassette to cassette copies unto the nth generation with speed errors and tape noise.

This copy was made on a Revox reel-to-reel half track and digited using Goldwave. Lots of processing later, using both Goldwave and Wave Purity, this is the best quality I could achive.

Any ex-pat who worked in Saudi Arabia will identify with at least one of the tracks. I understand that the band who wrote the lyrics and performed these songs was working for BritishAerospace and were arrested and deported (hence the name of the album) when the tapes came to the authorities attention.
